Method Detail

compile

public void compile(String inputFile,
                    boolean runAfterwards,
                    boolean verboseLogging,
                    boolean generateASTVisualization)
             throws org.antlr.runtime.RecognitionException,
                    IOException
Compile the input file You should always enter a file with a .nt extention. This will automatically generate .as, .tam and optionally .dot files. With the .as you could examine the generated TAM instructions. The .dot is a visual representation of the AST. And the .tam is a file you can put into the TAM Interpreter. After compilation the program will automatically be executed if runAfterwards is true.

Parameters:
inputFile - the input file should have the .nt extention
runAfterwards - enter true if you want to run afterwards the program
verboseLogging - enter true if you want verbose logging
generateASTVisualization - enter true if you want an AST visualization to be generated as a .dot file
Throws:
org.antlr.runtime.RecognitionException
IOException

printForVerboseLogging

public void printForVerboseLogging(String out)
Prints out if verbose logging is enabled.

Parameters:
out - the string to print to System.out

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method. This method will create a compiler object and call it with all options enabled. The first entered argument will be the location of the file that should be compiled and executed. In order for this program to work you should enter one argument linking to a .nt file that you whish to compile.

Parameters:
args - the arguments
